main.name: Tyler McEwen
main.occupation: 4th year Computer Science Student @ Lakehead University
main.bio: Hello! My name is Tyler McEwen and I am currently in my 4th of 5 years for a degree in Computer Science at Lakehead University. Throughout my degree I have held many roles within the IT sector and have both led and collaborated on a variety of software development projects. Keep scrolling for the specifics!
main.contactmessage: Whether inquiring about a job or collaboration opportunity, use this form to get in touch with me!

resume.skillmessage: I am skilled in the following technologies, among others.

education.description: During my time in university I have learnt and applied various technologies, worked in groups in a leadership capacity, and have met and worked with some truly amazing individuals.

work.title: Network Analyst Intern
work.description: Monitored the network and performed regular upgrades to software and firmware of devices in production. Replace all out of cycle network equipment in production with newer models. Manage, schedule, and execute the protocol upgrade to all capable devices in production.

work.title: Network and Server Technician Intern
work.description: Collaborated with fellow coworkers to manage the replacement of all out of cycle devices. Assist in the data center migration. Monitor incoming tickets and respond to them in a timely and effective manner.

work.title: Lead IT Field Technician
work.description: Received and prepared all technology that was to be used in the 2018 Ontario provincial election. Preparation involved loading voter databases, ensuring all equipment was functional, and imaging the various laptops for each voting location. It was then my responsibility to troubleshoot any issues that were encountered during voting times.

work.title: Computer Technician
work.description: Interface with customers in an attempt to understand their technological needs, then provide them with recommendations for certain products based on these needs. It was also my responsibility to troubleshoot the technological issues that customers were experiencing and to furnish a work order for all work that was done on the device.

projects.title: California Housing Prediction
projects.category: A cloud hosted machine learning application written in Python and Flask.

projects.title: Cryptocurrency Trading Bot
projects.category: An automated crypto trading bot written in Python that is triggered based on several technical indicators.

projects.title: Conway's Game of Life
projects.category: Conway's game of life implementation written in Kotlin and TornadoFX

projects.title: Document Similarity App
projects.category: Calculates the similarity of two documents based on cosine similarity. Written in Clojure

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
